result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley D Krinke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1. AODA and any follow-up.
2.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
Court orders the restitution to be paid within the first 6 months of probation.  JOINT & SEVERAL.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Ashley D Krinke
Current: 111 N Maple St  Apt 5, Black Creek, WI 54106 United States  (Effective: 05-16-2017)
Prior: 410 S Clark St, Black Creek, WI 54106 United States
Notice of entry of judgments have been returned.  Return to sender.  No mail receptacle. Unable to forward.

ADDRESS INFO for Ashley D Krinke
Current: 410 S Clark St, Black Creek, WI 54106 United States  (Effective: 03-16-2016)
Prior: N1684 Madison St, Manchester, WI 53946

1:57 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites plea agreement - defendant will plea to counts 2 & 3 on 2015CF8, count 1 on 2015CM21 and count 1 on 2015CF558.  DA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Statement by the court.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2 & 3 on 2015CF8, and orders counts 1 & 4 be dismissed and read-in, finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2015CM21 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in, and finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2015CM58.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CF8 (counts 2 & 3)

30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 2 years - with huber if revoked. Sentence is to be consecutive to any other sentence.

2015CM21 (count 1)

30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 2 years - with huber if revoked.  Sentence is to be consecutive to any other sentence.


2015CM58 (count 1)

60 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 2 years with huber if revoked, and concurrent to any other sentence.

CONDITIONS (EACH)  

AODA and any follow-up.
Court costs.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
2015CM58 - restitution of $360.00 joint & several and is to be paid wihtin the first 6 months.

No credit.

Court adjourned at 2:12 p.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

2:10 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat and defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing  on May 4, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:11 p.m.
